page.title: 16ASSYNT'S LOCAL HISTORY
page.content: Local History gives us the reasons for why so many things are as they are today. 900 years ago the land around her was owned by the Thane of Sutherland. The MacNicols of Ullapool helped fight plundering Vikings & were given the land of Assynt as a reward. Around 1500 the MacNicols married into the MacLeods of Lewis, thus began the Macleods of Assynt. Sir Joseph Bacon built a pier in 1745 & 50 fishing boats came. In 1800 people suffering from the Highland Clearances fled here & increased the population. In 1870 the Duke of Sutherland built a large lodge here. In 1936 the Vesty family bought the Estates of Assynt & are owned by them to this day. In 1948 the fishing Industry began in ernest. As a result Lochinver is a busy Fishing & Holiday village today, very dependendent on these for existance.
